dt: province of western Canada located north of Montana; capital Edmonton; most populous city is Calgary; {it}area{/it} 247,136 square miles (640,082 square kilometers), {it}population{/it} 3,290,350

shortdef: province of western Canada located north of Montana; capital Edmonton; most populous city is Calgary; area 247,136 square miles (640,082 square kilometers), population 3,290,350

dt: {bc}a fast-moving low-pressure weather system that develops east of the Rocky Mountains in western Canada during winter months and moves to the east-southeast across central Canada and into the northern U.S.
An Alberta Clipper typically brings very cold temperatures, high winds, and light snowfall amounts.

dt.t: Expect another {wi}Alberta Clipper{/wi} to move through southeastern Wisconsin this afternoon and tonight with about 1 to 2 inches of snow and then flurries on Saturday.

shortdef: a fast-moving low-pressure weather system that develops east of the Rocky Mountains in western Canada during winter months and moves to the east-southeast across central Canada and into the northern U.S.
